_prev_prog_3.TR_OtherType: Refrigeration workbook and RETA refrigeration operator training
_prev_prog_3.Description:
PREVENTION PROGRAM DESCRIPTION



The Americold hazardous material release Prevention Program in place for compliance with 40 CFR 68 RMP is based on the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard 29 CFR 1910.119 in conjunction with industry guidelines of the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration, IIAR. The first element in the safe function of ammonia refrigeration equipment is in the design itself.  All components in the refrigeration system are designed and installed in compliance with the industry standards of ANSI/IIAR ASHRAE, ASME and jurisdictional codes in effect at the time of construction.  In order for this system to function safely and effectively over a long period of time, maintenance and inspections are conducted on a scheduled basis to assure system integrity and functional efficiency. Maintenance and system monitoring is accomplished by employees that are trained to follow safe work procedures when operating the equipment. Also built into the system are automated engineered safeguards that continually monitor the operating equipment to maintain pressures, temperatures, liquid levels and detection of accidental releases.  In the event of a system upset, warning systems are in place 24/7 to alert operators of operational deviations before they become emergencies.



Operator training is among the most important elements of the release prevention program.  Initially the prevention program began with the gathering of equipment information and employee involvement in the process hazard analysis PHA study.  The PHA methodology used for the study is the hazards and operability (Hazop) study.  The PHA team used this method to identify whether hazards exist and then identify the actions necessary to correct them.   Other areas of training include development of operating and maintenance procedures and safe work practices, process safety compliance audits, emergency response hands-on practice in mock spill drills and the use of personal protection equipment.   



Operators receive emergency responder training in order to understand how to evaluate and manage emergency situations safely and effectively.  Release prevention begins with mitigating even the smallest of leaks that occur operationally.  These are take very seriously to avoid failures that contribute to more serious releases.  Lock-out/tag-out, pump out procedures and line opening,  procedures are very important for preventing further hazards when making even minor repairs on the system.  Employees in general also receive training for ammonia awareness for knowledge of ammonia hazards, exposure prevention and what to do in the event exposure would occur.   The emergency procedures established for the facility includes and emergency action and fire prevention  plan. 

For continued improvement of the release prevention plan, internal safety audits are conducted that include reviews of safe work procedures, siting evaluations and recommendations for any deficiencies identified that affect the safety of the ammonia refrigeration process.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary for Americold, Zumbrota, MN



RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN AND DATA ELEMENTS

The following subsections outline the Executive Summary requirements of the EPA's 40 CFR Part 68.155.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

The Americold Zumbrota facility abides by the emergency action procedures and policies

detailed in the Emergency Action Plan manual. This Plan was designed to meet the following objectives:

1.) To save lives.

2.) To minimize and avoid injuries.

3.) To protect the environment.

4.) To minimize property damage.

AmeriCold Logistics maintains a (safety) committee whose members are the

designated emergency coordinators for the facility. The Plan provides the action organization and

notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards, and mitigation procedures which will be

implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise at the facility. This Plan is

reviewed and updated at least once per year. This Plan will be reviewed and updated to ensure compliance

with the PSM and RMP regulations, as well as to incorporate any facility changes.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE

The Americold Zumbrota facility chills and stores a variety of food products in their cold

storage warehouse. The refrigeration process, consisting of piping, valves, and equipment, cycles ammonia

through various physical states (high pressure liquid, low pressure liquid, low pressure vapor, high pressure

vapor, then back to high pressure liquid) in order to provide refrigeration for cold storage rooms. Changes in

pressure are directly related to changes in temperature. For example, lowering the ammonia pressure lowers

its temperature. Low pressure (cold) liquid ammonia provides refrigeration by removing ambient heat from a

room or product. Removal of ambient heat causes the liquid ammonia (contained within the system) to

vaporize. Heat is later removed from the ammonia as it is condensed

back into a liquid. Typical operating

conditions range from vacuum (approximately 1" Hg) on the low pressure side of the system to 150-160 psig

on the high side.

Anhydrous ammonia (CAS #7664-41-7) is used as the refrigerant in the refrigeration process.

The total ammonia inventory exceeds the Threshold Quantity for Accidental Release Prevention.



HAZARD ASSESSMENT SUMMARY

Worst Case Release Result Summary

Deleted per regulation.

Alternative Release Result Summary

Deleted per regulation



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

This facility operates in accordance with the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) guidelines

and standards including the following:

IIAR Bulletin 107, "Suggested Safety and Operating Procedures When Making Ammonia Refrigeration Tie-ins"

IIAR Bulletin 109, "Minimum Safety Criteria for a Safe Ammonia Refrigeration System"

IIAR Bulletin R1, "A Guide to Good Practices for the Operation of an Ammonia Refrigeration System"

In addition, the Americold Zumbrota has implemented a Process Safety Management

program for compliance with the OSHA 1910.199 regulation.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no RMP reportable releases of ammonia at this facility over the last five years



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Americold Zumbrota has an Emergency action Plan in place.  The facility has personnel that are trained to First Responder Operations Level on an annual basis.  All are fit tested and respiratory trained annually.   

During the RMP Development Review, it was recommended that the facility conduct annual evacuation drills to ensure all employees understand the emergency response procedures.  In addition, it was recommended that the facility contact the local Fire Department regarding participation in the evacuation drills.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

As part of the review of the Process Safety Management program at this facility and the update of the Process

Hazard Analysis study generated mitigation measures that would improve safety at the Americold Zumbrota facility located at 1000 Artic Avenue, Zumbrota, MN    These action items were included in a management plan and have been addressed.
